Math and Writing are the\rtwo primary/major areas of focus for the staff due to the data we received from our site and state assessments. Teachers will attend conferences
column3: \rtrainings and after-school workshops. In-class coaching and time for weekly collaboration is provided to assist teachers throughout the school year.\r\rAcross the District:\r\rSCIENCE –\r\rThe primary areas of focus for staff and administrator development have been related to the adoption of the Next Generation Science Standards (NGSS)\rand moving teachers and administrators into implementation.  Focus areas include: 1) Building leadership capacity
column4: 2) Scaling up Professional Learning\rand Support to include all district teachers
column5: 3) Planning instruction aligned to the Next Generation Science Standards
column7: and 5) Addressing supplemental instructional materials.\r\rProfessional development needs were determined via district-wide Needs Assessment Surveys

column9: and feedback data collected via prior professional learning events in the district.\r\rProfessional Learning for the 2019-20 school year will address all levels/cohorts of teachers and administrators in the district through continued\rleadership
column11: and content training.  This will occur primarily through science lesson study for all TK-8 teachers of science to include MS ELA\rteachers
column14: and a review of publisher materials.\r\rCore Leadership Team and established Teacher Leaders will continue to receive training in the areas of Leadership
column15: Facilitation of Professional Learning\rfor their peers
column16: and deepening understanding of NGSS innovations
column18: and pedagogy via the NGSS Early Implementation Initiative Program.\r“Expansion” (all other district teachers) teachers will be provided NGSS professional learning facilitated by their district Teacher Leader peers through\rthe established lesson study model
column20: and district PD days.\rOther opportunities for science professional learning include supplemental material/planning work supported by a CA Regional Environmental Education\rCommunity (CREEC) partnership
column21: and instructional material evaluation.\r\rAdministrator professional learning will address NGSS innovations
column22: strategies to identify and support high quality science instruction (observations and\rfeedback) and sustainability.  This support will occur both on site and through district management meetings via the Early Implementer Initiative.\r\rNext Generation Science Standards Teacher Leaders
